title: Summary Tab
text: TABLE OF CONTENTS Summary details Copy Master Item Additional Information The Summary tab allows you to view and edit the Master Item Information. A Master Item identifies a range of items (or variants) that are linked by a common theme. Master Items are not physical items that can be sold, they logically link variants together. For example you sell T-shirts in a range of colours and sizes. The price, cost, vendor and other details are the same across these items. The Master Item shown on the Summary tab is the link between these variants. The Matrix tab will show specific details for the range of colours and sizes you physically stock and sell the T-shirt in. Summary Header This is made up of the Item Name and Master Item Number, as shown on the Item list. In the example here Hand Bag is the Item Name and 10003 is the Master Item Number. Images See the How to use the Image Media Library article for details about managing an item's images. Summary details Return to the Item List page. Ensure any changes are saved before returning to the Item List. This saves all information belonging to the Master Item Summary tab. Name This is the Master Item Name. Used by the Item List and by parts of Imagine where the items are listed at Master Item level instead of variant level. Manufacturer Item No This is the manufacturer item number at the Summary level. Note: This can be different at a variant level. Default Label Template This is the label format which will be used for label printing unless an alternative format is selected at the time of printing. Active This is where you can set an item to be Active or Inactive. At the summary level, this is for all variants that belong to the item. To make individual variants active or inactive, use the option on the matrix tab against the variant. An inactive item may be excluded from certain parts of the system. Inactive items can be made active again at a later date. Previous Vendors This field shows the previous Vendors that the item was assigned. For reference purposes. Type This is to distinguish if this item is stock or sample. Description This field is an extended description of the Name field and is commonly used to hold more descriptive information about a product, such as material type, weight, size, artist information, design notes, etc. The Description can be different at a variant level. Variants This shows how many Active and Inactive variants belong to the Master Item. Clicking on the Edit Pencil on the right will take you straight to the Matrix tab where you can view and edit the variants. Sales Price Range This shows the highest selling price and the lowest selling price of the variants within the item. If only one price is shown, then all items are the same selling price. Last Cost Range This shows the highest and lowest cost of the variants for the item across all shops. If only one cost is shown, then all items are that cost. Copy Master Item This is a quick way of creating an item based on an existing item, especially if most of the field information is the same. After choosing Copy Master Item you will be prompted for a new Master Item number. Fill in as required or if left blank, it will use the next available system item number. The green Copy Master Item button will create a copy of the item. When you copy an item, it is important to give it proper attention. Specifically, you need to make adjustments to the Item Name field on both the Summary and Matrix tabs. The original Item Name will have the prefix [Copy] added to it. Additionally, remember to modify any other fields as necessary. Helpful Tip: To easily locate the copied item, simply type the word "Copy" into the search bar. Additional Information After creating an item, any modifications made to the Summary tab will only apply to the Summary tab itself. If there is a corresponding field on the Matrix tab, it must be separately updated, as these variants can have distinct information based on colour, size, etc. The fields that should be amended separately on the Matrix tab include Manufacturer Item Number, Vendor Number, Image URL, Name, and Description.
description:
TABLE OF CONTENTS

  • Summary details
  • Copy Master Item
  • Additional Information


The Summary tab allows you to view and edit the Master Item Information. A Master Item identifies a range of items (or variants) that are linked by a common theme. Master Items are not physical items that can be sold, they logically link variants together. 


For example you sell T-shirts in a range of colours and sizes. The price, cost, vendor and other details are the same across these items. The Master Item shown on the Summary tab is the link between these variants. The Matrix tab will show specific details for the range of colours and sizes you physically stock and sell the T-shirt in.


Summary HeaderThis is made up of the Item Name and Master Item Number, as shown on the Item list. In the example here Hand Bag is the Item Name and 10003 is the Master Item Number.
Images

See the How to use the Image Media Library article for details about managing an item's images.


Summary details

Return to the Item List page. Ensure any changes are saved before returning to the Item List.
This saves all information belonging to the Master Item Summary tab.


NameThis is the Master Item Name. Used by the Item List and by parts of Imagine where the items are listed at Master Item level instead of variant level. 
Manufacturer Item NoThis is the manufacturer item number at the Summary level. Note: This can be different at a variant level.
Default Label TemplateThis is the label format which will be used for label printing unless an alternative format is selected at the time of printing.
ActiveThis is where you can set an item to be Active or Inactive. At the summary level, this is for all variants that belong to the item. To make individual variants active or inactive, use the option on the matrix tab against the variant. An inactive item may be excluded from certain parts of the system. Inactive items can be made active again at a later date. 
Previous VendorsThis field shows the previous Vendors that the item was assigned. For reference purposes.
TypeThis is to distinguish if this item is stock or sample.
DescriptionThis field is an extended description of the Name field and is commonly used to hold more descriptive information about a product, such as material type, weight, size, artist information, design notes, etc. The Description can be different at a variant level.
VariantsThis shows how many Active and Inactive variants belong to the Master Item. Clicking on the Edit Pencil on the right will take you straight to the Matrix tab where you can view and edit the variants. 
Sales Price RangeThis shows the highest selling price and the lowest selling price of the variants within the item. If only one price is shown, then all items are the same selling price.
Last Cost RangeThis shows the highest and lowest cost of the variants for the item across all shops. If only one cost is shown, then all items are that cost. 


Copy Master Item

This is a quick way of creating an item based on an existing item, especially if most of the field information is the same. After choosing Copy Master Item you will be prompted for a new Master Item number. Fill in as required or if left blank, it will use the next available system item number. The green Copy Master Item button will create a copy of the item.



When you copy an item, it is important to give it proper attention. Specifically, you need to make adjustments to the Item Name field on both the Summary and Matrix tabs. The original Item Name will have the prefix [Copy] added to it. Additionally, remember to modify any other fields as necessary.


Helpful Tip: To easily locate the copied item, simply type the word "Copy" into the search bar.




Additional Information

After creating an item, any modifications made to the Summary tab will only apply to the Summary tab itself. If there is a corresponding field on the Matrix tab, it must be separately updated, as these variants can have distinct information based on colour, size, etc. The fields that should be amended separately on the Matrix tab include Manufacturer Item Number, Vendor Number, Image URL, Name, and Description.

title: Custom Attributes Tab
text: The Custom Attribute tab allows you to manage different attributes of an item. These attributes have been created beforehand in the Custom Attributes Module. To add an attribute to an item, simply click the "+" button on the page. From the list of available Custom Attributes, click on each to add. They now appear in the list showing the Name, Label Code, Data Type and Required Status. To delete a Custom Attribute from an item, please follow these steps: Check if the Required status of the attribute is set to "NO." Custom Attributes with a Required status of "YES" cannot be directly deleted. If the Required status is set to "NO," locate the attribute in the list and click on the delete icon (usually represented by a trash bin or a cross symbol) next to it. This action will remove the attribute from the item. In case the Custom Attribute has a Required status of "YES," you will need to modify the attribute's set up in the Custom Attribute section of Item Management. Change the Required setting to "NO" for that attribute. Once the Required status is updated to "NO," the attribute will appear in the list with the modified status, allowing you to remove it by clicking on the delete icon. Remember that deleting a Custom Attribute from an item will remove its associated data or values from that item.

title: Hierarchy Tab
text: In the Hierarchy tab of the Item Hierarchies Module, you can view the items you have previously set up. The tab initially displays the top-level hierarchies. If a hierarchy has sub levels or lower-level categories, a gray arrow is shown to the left of its name, indicating the availability of further options. It's important to note that each item can only be assigned to a single hierarchy at a time.

title: Miscellaneous Tab
text: The miscellaneous tab in Imagine encompasses essential functions and settings for efficiently managing the item across the platform. OptionDescription POS Block Discount When the box is checked, the item is blocked from being discounted at the POS. When unchecked, the item can be discounted. If an item is already in PPE Item Prices or PPE Item bundles and it is marked as "Block Discount," consider removing it from the PPE list. The item will still be discounted as this option does not automatically remove it from any PPE list. POS Prompt for Price When the box is checked, a prompt appears at the POS asking the user to enter a price. When unchecked, the item is not prompted for a price. POS Block Quantity Entry When the box is checked, the user cannot change the quantity of the item being sold. When unchecked, a quantity can be set against the item. Enable as Web Item When the box is checked, the item is flagged as web-enabled. Do not place on Purchase Order When the box is checked, the item can no longer be added to purchase orders. Save Saves the settings on the tab. Toggle the options To set them on for the item(s). These options can also be found and edited within the individual items themselves, accessed via the Matrix Tab.

title: Matrix Tab - Details section
text: The Matrix tab shows detailed information about specific Variant items. Every item in Imagine is a variant, with an associated master item, even if there is only one variant item. Variant items (often referred to as just 'variant') are the physical items you sell in your shop such as an XL blue T-shirt. Master items group similar variant items together such as all T-shirts irrespective of size or colour. Variant item details are shown here whilst master item details are shown on the Summary tab. Note: ensure you click the Save button after making any changes in the Details section. Changes will be lost if you navigate away without saving Images See the How to use the Image Media Library article for details about managing an item's images. Dimension See the Matrix Tab - How to Add and Edit Dimensions on an Item article for details about managing an item's dimensions. Name This is the variant item's name used to identify it within Imagine, such as where the items are listed or selected. This name can be the same across variant items, master items and other items so consideration should be given to ensure easy identification of individual items when viewing data across multiple items. Weighted Average Cost Range Shows the weighted average cost for the item in the tenant and given as a range across all shops where the first figure is the lowest weighted average cost across all shops and the last figure is the highest weighted average cost across all shops. Weighted average cost is the only method used in Imagine to calculate profits, cost sales and margins. Sales Price This is the default retail selling price of the variant item where a specific Local Price is not available. Note: the Sales Price remains unchanged across all shops irrespective of an individual shops currency. This should be taken in to consideration if Local Prices are not available. Last Cost Range The Last Cost is the most recent cost recorded for an item during a receive process, such as Goods Received, Transfers (including inter-company transfers), or any other receipt of stock. As costs can be shop and currency dependant, Last Cost Range is shown as a range from lowest to highest cost and shown in tenant currency. Barcodes This shows all barcodes assigned to a variant item. To add a barcode, key in the number and press the return key on the keyboard. To remove a barcode, click on the "X" to delete. Vendor Cost The vendor's own catalogue cost for an item. This is used as the default cost on POs when ordering the item. Shown in tenant currency. Manufacturer Item No This is the Manufacturer's Item number at the variant level. An example of a Manufacturer Item Number is ISBN number for books, or PLU's for fresh goods. This can be different from the Summary Manufacturer Item number and the other variants items. It can also be different from the Vendors Item Number. Tax Code This is the Tax Rate applied when the variant item is sold. Note: The tax rate can be different for each variant. If there are multiple Tax Groups, select a Tax Rate from each group as required. Only one tax rate can be chosen from each group. Tags A Tag is a piece of information that can be attached to an item, mainly for reference or reporting purposes. They are similar to the Custom Attributes on items but express a range of values rather than a single fixed attribute. Key in the value and press return to build up a list of Tags for the item. Previously entered Tags are shown to help avoid duplication or close alternative tags. Vendor Item No This is the Vendors own catalogue number, which can be different to your variant item number. Used by the vendor to identify the item required on a PO. This can be different between variants in the same Master Item. Editable via Vendor Management, see below. Sales UOM Code UOM is a Unit of Measure by which an item is sold, for example weight, length, pack size. UOM can be different for each variant. Note: this field is for reference purposes only. Description This field is an extended description of the Name field and is commonly used to hold more descriptive information about a product. Examples can be material type, weight, size, artist information, design notes, etc. Note: this field may appear as the item's variant description in some parts of Imagine. Description can be different at Summary level as well as across other variants. Restock Level This is the maximum amount of stock to hold for the variant item, and can be different for each variant. This is used to Auto Populate POs. See Purchase Order for more details. This detail is also shown on the Stock Lookup Summary tab. Reorder Point This shows the lowest amount of stock to be held for an item and at which point the item requires ordering. It is used to Auto Populate PO's, see Purchase Order for more details. Reorder Point detail is also shown on the Stock Lookup Summary tab. The Reorder Point value can be different for each variant item. Primary Vendor Each variant item in Imagine must be associated with one or more vendors. Where an item is only associated with one vendor this vendor is by default the Primary Vendor. This field displays the variant item's primary vendor. Where an item is associated with more than one vendor you must nominate one vendor to be the Primary Vendor. This Primary Vendor is the vendor used in selections such as Purchase Orders and reports. To manage vendor for a variant item use the Vendor Management function. See the Vendor Management section below. Active This is where you set a variant item to be Active or Inactive (known as its 'active state'). Other variants will not be affected by the change in active state here, but the Summary item will have its active state altered to ensure consistency, using the following rules: If the Summary item and all variants are inactive and one variant is made active, the Summary item is made active. If all variants are made inactive, the Summary item will be made inactive. To make all variants inactive or active, use the Summary tab option. An inactive variant may be excluded from certain parts of the system. Inactive variants can be made active again by using the Show Active option in Item List. Shortcut When set to ON, the variant item is shown as an Item Shortcut on the PoS. When set to OFF, the variant item is not shown as an Item Shortcut on the PoS. By default, Shortcut is set as Off. This value can be set per variant item. Vendor Management A variant item can be associated with one or more vendors. Each item must be associated with at least one vendor and where this is the case this vendor is classed as the Primary Vendor. Where an item is associated with two or more vendors then one vendor must be nominated as the Primary Vendor. Vendor Management gives you the ability to manage these associations as well as other key information that is relevant to an item and its vendor. The Primary Vendor is the default option within Imagine where vendor/item relationships are required. For example, when making a Purchase Order a vendor must be chosen. The range of items then displayed for this Purchase Order is taken as all items where this vendor is the primary vendor. By having more than one vendor you can switch to an alternative vendor where the current primary vendor may not be able to supplier you this item. Select a vendor from the drop down and click Add to add this new vendor to the list of Available Vendors. Search this list by typing in relevant letters of the vendors name, this will narrow the list of vendors shown. Vendor Item No This is the Vendors own catalogue number, which can be different to your item number. Used by the vendor to identify the item required on a PO. This can be different between variants in the same Master Item. Primary Vendor Toggle on or off as required. Only one vendor can be the primary vendor and there must be a primary vendor. To change the primary vendor to this vendor, edit the vendor line, check the Primary Vendor box and click Save. The Primary Vendor will move to this vendor. Min Order Information only field of the vendors minimum number of these items a vendor will accept on a purchase order. Pack Size Information only field of the number of items in a pack. For example the vendor supplies boxes of pencils that come as 50 in a box. You should order based on this pack size i.e. multiples of 50 such as 50, 100, 350, 5000 etc. Cost The cost at which the vendor will supply the item, expressed in the vendors accepted currency. Tax The tax rate attributable to this item Edit the related line Save changes made to this line Revert changes to this line Delete the vendors association with this item. Only applies to vendors that are not selected as the primary vendor. This does not delete the vendor, only the association. Rest all values to zero

title: Matrix Tab -Standard Attributes, Local Prices and Custom Attributes sections
text: Important! If you move to another tab without saving, you will lose all changes. Enable as Web Item Marking an item and its variants as 'web item' will allow integrations to e-commerce sites to be selective about which items to import. It will also be available for reporting and analysis. Do not place on Purchase Order When a PO is automatically created or is selected based on filtering by vendor or hierarchy, there may be some items you do not wish to include because they are poor sellers or you have more than already needed. This option gives the ability to preclude these items from future POs, allowing you to better manage inventory levels. Custom Attributes This is where you see the custom attributes that were added in the Custom Attributes tab. Local Prices This is where you see prices for shops with different currencies. Estimated Margins Displays each Tax Rate and Estimated Margin. Save This saves all information belonging to the Item.

title: Matrix Tab - How to Add and Edit Dimensions on an Item
text: To add a new dimension value to an item, select the Dimensions button. This will load a Dimensions window showing the item's current dimension details. Header name indicates the Dimension Type e.g. [Colour. Size, Weight]. Under each will be the Dimension Name and the set of Dimension Values currently used. [Patterns,Check, Plain and Diamond.] Vertical/Horizontal indicates which direction they appear in a grid view. Click the Add button on the Dimension you wish to create a new value for. Input the new dimension value. e.g. Stars Click OK to add to the dimension. NOTE: This will add a new pattern called Stars with 4 sizes, (XS, SM, MD LG) Click on the top right-hand X of the Dimensions panel to save and close. The Current Work Item Number list will now show the newly created item variants highlighted in Orange. For each new variant, check and amend each field as required. NOTE: Remember to Save after viewing and editing the newly added variants.

title: Matrix Tab - How to Copy Values from One Variant to Another
text: When editing an item, it is possible to copy the value of one variant to all other variants using the Multi Edit icon which appears to the right of the field. NOTE: Not all fields have this option. The value to be copied must be shown in the field to start with. e.g., 20.00 Click on the Multi Edit icon. title: Movements Tab
text: The Movements tab shows the movement (or audit trail) of an item or variant throughout Imagine. Movements can be broken down by shop, movement type and by date. From* The start date of the item's movement (manually enter a date or click into the mini calendar to select) To* The end date of the item's movement (manually enter a date or click into the mini calendar to select) Movement Type Select a movement type from the drop-down list. If left blank, then all movement types will be shown. If selecting a type, only 1 can be selected at a time. Shop Select a shop from the drop-down list. NOTE: Only active shops are shown. To make a shop active, see Back Office - Shops. If left blank, then all shops will be shown. If selecting a shop, only 1 can be selected at a time. Item Select an item variant from the drop-down list. If left blank, then all variants will be shown. If selecting an item variant, only 1 can be selected at a time. Search Finds all movements based on the search criteria entered. Once the search completes the view will update to show a Grid with the movements. Column Chooser Located at the top right of the grid panel is a Column Chooser icon, which lets the user add and remove columns [fields] to/from the grid view. Add a Column From the Column Chooser box, drag the column to the grid view. Remove a Column From the grid view, drag the column to the Column Chooser box. Close Column Chooser To close the Column Chooser, use the X at the top right of the box. Alternative grid view with Name and Item Number added, but with Barcode and User removed. The data grid shows the following. (some options may be hidden within the Column Chooser) NOTE: The grid view is not saved and will revert to the default view upon exiting the item. Date Date of the movement. Barcode The item's primary barcode. Dimensions A concatenated field containing all dimensions applicable to the item. User The user that performed/recorded the item movement. Movement Type The type of movement. From Shop The shop that the movement originated from. To Shop The shop that received the movement of goods. Quantity The quantity of the movement adjustment. Item Number The item variant number. Name The item variant name. Reference This is the Receive Goods Number.

title: Figures Tab
text: The Figures tab allows you to see different types of Inventory data based on a date period. The figures are shown in grid format by shop and variant with some options to alter the grid view. See the How to Alter the Grid View in Figures page for more details on this. Movement Header This is made up of the Master Item Name field (e.g. I love Birmingham T-Shirt) followed by the Master Item Number (e.g. 010012). From* The start date of the item's activity (manually enter a date or click the date selector icon). The start date is included in results. To* The end date of the item's activity (manually enter a date or click the date selector icon). The end date is included in results. Company Use this filter to select a particular company(s). See Inter-Company Trading for more details. Search Finds all figures based on the search criteria entered. Back to List Return to the Item List. This will then display a data grid from the selected filters. In the example shops are shown as rows and sizes are shown as columns. Each row is broken down to data components that describe different figures for the items. Sold The number of units sold in the selected period. On Hand The current quantity of items in-store that are available to sell. This includes Reserved stock but excludes Offline. Reserved The number of units reserved for customer collections, such as web orders. In Transit The number of units in transit between shops, awaiting completion of the transfer. Specifically, this is the quantity of items that have been transferred out from the shop but have not been received at the 'transfer in' shop. Once the receiving shop has transferred this item in then the stock is no longer deemed as 'In Transit'. On Order The number of units requested from a vendor but not yet delivered. This figure is based on the number of items on all Placed PO's in-line with the given filters. Available Calculated as On Hand - (Offline + Reserved) = Available. It represents the number of units available for immediate sale. Cost Price The weighted average shop cost of items at the item/location level, required for accurate reporting of profit margins. Note: the Cost Price here is the weighted average shop cost rather than the weighted average tenant cost as shown in the Item report. Location The shop whose figures are being shown. Offline The number of units held as offline stock for the shop. Value On Hand The sum of On Hand multiplied by Cost Price, representing the total value of stock on hand for the shop. Note: this can differ from the Value On-hand as shown in the Item report due to the shop Cost Price value used.

title: Figures Tab - How to Alter the Grid View
text: The grid view can be changed to show the different types of figures, change the vertical and horizontal selections, or add a filter. All Section This is a list of the grid selections available to show in the grid view. Rows The vertical selection on the left-hand side of the grid. Columns The horizontal selection on the top panel of the grid. Data The type of figure that you wish to see, such as Sales, On Hand, On Order, Store, etc. Filters This is where you can choose to see only certain information from one of the Grid Selections. For example, you can filter to see only one of your two stores in the grid. Add/Remove Grid selections can be added and removed by ticking the grid selection On or Off in the ALL section. Tick Off Removes the grid selection from the Rows, Columns, Data, or Filter sections. Tick On Adds the grid selection back into one of the Rows, Columns, Data, or Filter sections. Alternatively, they can be dragged and dropped between each section. A Grid selection can only belong to 1 section at a time, Rows, Columns, Data or Filter Filter Selection This is where you can choose to see only certain information from one of the Grid Selections. For example, to see only one of your two stores in the grid, rather than both stores. Drag the Location field to Filters This action involves dragging the Location field to the Filters section. Click on the Filter icon [top right] Clicking on the Filter icon, located at the top right corner, opens the filter panel. Within the panel, select which store to view. Once the filter panel is open, you can select the specific store you want to view from the available options. OK to apply. After making the selection, click OK to apply the filter. Grid View Order If more than one grid selection is in a section, the order in which it is displayed is the order it appears in the grid. Change the order by dragging the selections into the correct order. The example below is On Hand, then Sales, then Reserved. Drag the Sale selection above the On Hand selection. Before View The order has now changed to Sale, On Hand, Reserved. After View

text: The Print Label tab is where barcode labels can be printed for the item. Header This is made up of the Master Item Name field followed by the Master Item Number - as shown on the Item list. title: How to Use the Image Media Library
text: TABLE OF CONTENTS Upload Image Image Library URL Image The Imagine Image Media Library serves as a platform for uploading, storing, organising, and assigning images to your items. To add or remove an image associated with an item, follow these steps: Click on the Add button. This action will reveal the Image Media Library, where you can manage your images. The Image Library displays the images you have uploaded, which can be assigned to items. If you haven't uploaded any items yet, you will need to add some images to the library before proceeding. To access the Image Library, click on the Add button. This action will open a pop-up window with the following tabs: Upload: Allows you to upload new images to the library. Sort: This enables you to organize and sort your existing images. Assign: Allows you to assign images to specific items. Settings: Provides access to additional settings and preferences related to the Image Library. Please note that these tabs will be visible once the pop-up window appears after clicking the Add button. Upload Image To add an image to the Image Library, you can either drag and drop the image file into the indicated area or click on the marked area to browse for an image. Accepted file types for the images are as follows: .jpg, .png, .jpeg, .gif, .svg, .webp. You can select any image files with these extensions to upload them to the Image Library. Image Library The Image Library displays the images currently stored in your library. To delete an image from the library, follow these steps: Select the image(s) you want to delete by clicking on them. Once the desired image(s) are selected, click on the "Delete" button. This action will remove the selected image(s) from your library. Please note that deleting an image from the library does not delete it from any associated item(s) that have already been assigned to it. URL Image If you wish to include a link to an image that is located outside of Imagine, kindly provide the URL in the designated space below and select "Import." Please note that since the image is stored externally, if it is ever deleted or becomes unavailable, we will be unable to display the image within the Imagine app. To select an image and highlight it in green, please click on the image(s) you wish to associate with your item and then click "Add." Remember that the same image can be assigned to multiple items. The primary image, which is displayed as a large image, is determined by the order of the thumbnail stack. To change the primary image, simply drag the desired image to the leftmost position in the stack. The large image will then reflect this change. If you want to remove an image associated with an item, select the corresponding image thumbnail and click "Remove." Please note that this action will only remove the association between the image and the item, and the image will still be available in the Image Media Library. The image itself will not be permanently deleted.
description:
TABLE OF CONTENTS

  • Upload Image
  • Image Library
  • URL Image

The Imagine Image Media Library serves as a platform for uploading, storing, organising, and assigning images to your items.


To add or remove an image associated with an item, follow these steps:

  • Click on the Add button.
  • This action will reveal the Image Media Library, where you can manage your images.



The Image Library displays the images you have uploaded, which can be assigned to items. If you haven't uploaded any items yet, you will need to add some images to the library before proceeding.


To access the Image Library, click on the Add button. This action will open a pop-up window with the following tabs:

  • Upload: Allows you to upload new images to the library.
  • Sort: This enables you to organize and sort your existing images.
  • Assign: Allows you to assign images to specific items.
  • Settings: Provides access to additional settings and preferences related to the Image Library.

Please note that these tabs will be visible once the pop-up window appears after clicking the Add button.



Upload Image

To add an image to the Image Library, you can either drag and drop the image file into the indicated area or click on the marked area to browse for an image.


Accepted file types for the images are as follows: .jpg, .png, .jpeg, .gif, .svg, .webp. You can select any image files with these extensions to upload them to the Image Library.



Image Library

The Image Library displays the images currently stored in your library.


To delete an image from the library, follow these steps:

  • Select the image(s) you want to delete by clicking on them.
  • Once the desired image(s) are selected, click on the "Delete" button.
  • This action will remove the selected image(s) from your library.

Please note that deleting an image from the library does not delete it from any associated item(s) that have already been assigned to it.



URL Image

If you wish to include a link to an image that is located outside of Imagine, kindly provide the URL in the designated space below and select "Import."


Please note that since the image is stored externally, if it is ever deleted or becomes unavailable, we will be unable to display the image within the Imagine app.



To select an image and highlight it in green, please click on the image(s) you wish to associate with your item and then click "Add." Remember that the same image can be assigned to multiple items.


The primary image, which is displayed as a large image, is determined by the order of the thumbnail stack. To change the primary image, simply drag the desired image to the leftmost position in the stack. The large image will then reflect this change.


If you want to remove an image associated with an item, select the corresponding image thumbnail and click "Remove." Please note that this action will only remove the association between the image and the item, and the image will still be available in the Image Media Library. The image itself will not be permanently deleted.

title: Item List Overview
text: The Item List page will show all items. You can choose to show or not show inactive items in this list. Use the Search bar to enter a search term. Press the green browse button to continue the search of all items. If you wish to see inactive items in any results ensure you toggle the 'Show Inactive' option on. Clear the search bar of any search terms ready to make a new search. Do not show inactive items in the search results. Show inactive items in the search results. Start the search. The Enter button on the keyboard will perform the same action. This will bring up a list of options to add or remove columns. Name This is the Master Item Name. Item Number This is the Master Item Number. Hierarchy Name The Name for the item as shown in the Hierarchy Tab. Hierarchy Code The Code for the item as shown in the Hierarchy Tab. Primary Vendor(s) The Vendor shown here is the primary vendor most often associated with variants across the Master Item. Where there are even numbers of 'most used' Primary Vendors then the vendor shown here is the most used primary vendor that was first associated with an variant in the Master Item. i.e. the longest associated, most popular Primary Vendor. Sales Price The Selling price of an item. If there are different selling prices between shops the lowest and highest sales price are displayed. For example: If Shop A = 20.00, Shop B = 17.00, Shop C = 25.00 and Shop D = 20, the range is 17.00 : 25.00 as Shop B being the lowest and Shop C being the highest. On-Hand Range The lowest and highest stock figure of the item over all shops. For example: If Shop A = 3, Shop B = 5, Shop C = 55 and Shop D = 20, the range is 3 : 55 as Shop A being the lowest and Shop C being the highest. Total On-Hand The total stock over all shops. Manufacturer Item No This is the manufacturer item number at the Summary level. Unit Cost The lowest and highest Cost Price range, displayed in the tenants base currency. Item List Search You can use symbols or words in your search to make your search results more precise. Some other common search techniques are: Exclude words from your search Put - in front of a word you want to leave out. For example, car -seat will exclude results that include seat Search for an exact match Put a word or phase inside quotes. For example, "car" will only show results with car Wildcard search Put * before or after the search string. For example, ca* will show results where ca is the beginning part of the word like carpet, case, caterpillar, cabinet as well as car. Can use at the beginning of a set of letters too like *ar to find bar, jar, star as well as car
